img.alt: Very small member of the toy breed family Head is very round Muzzle is proportionally very small Ears are large and held up, hanging to the sides when the dog is relaxed Coat can be either short or long, and wavy or flat when long Eyes are large and round

img.alt: Breed originating in Mexico, probably descended from the Techichi, companion dogs in the Toltec civilization Remains found from the time of the Aztecs in the modern-day Chihuahua region of Mexico Regarded as sacred by members of the Aztec nobility Rediscovered centuries after the fall of the Aztec empire in 1850 and introduced to the United States One of several theories suggests this breed originated in Europe, based on a dog in a 1480 fresco by Sandro Botticelli

img.alt: The Chihuahua is the smallest breed of dog, and is named after the Mexican state of Chihuahua.
